AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS makes a clearly incorrect claim about the customer’s configuration (that there is no broad *.apple.com entry), despite the attached screenshot analysis showing *.apple.com already present. This undermines troubleshooting because it recommends adding something that is already configured.
evidence: ATLAS (public, 2025-10-15T10:32:12+00:00): "Most relevant Apple CDN and update domains are included ... but there is no broad *.apple.com entry."
ATLAS file analysis (private, 2025-10-15T10:31:44+00:00) on Adressgroup.jpeg: "Multiple Apple-related domains are included ... appldnld.apple.com, *.apple.com, apple.com, *.cdn-apple.com ..."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There are only two customer-facing ATLAS responses, and later human agents respond and escalate to L2. The customer is not stuck in a long AI-only loop, and the AI is not shown requesting the same exact information repeatedly.

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support/ATLAS recommends changes based on a mistaken premise that a wildcard Apple domain is missing, despite evidence in the provided screenshots showing it already exists. This indicates the response did not properly incorporate the customer-provided configuration.
evidence: Customer provided updated screenshots/config context (2025-10-15T10:31:09+00:00): "unfortunately, the Allow rule didn’t resolve the issue. [See fotos.]"
ATLAS file analysis (2025-10-15T10:31:44+00:00): "*.apple.com" is present in the HTTPS exclusions address group.
ATLAS (public, 2025-10-15T10:32:12+00:00): "The absence of a blanket *.apple.com entry... Action: Add *.apple.com..."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There are multiple gaps of 3+ days between customer follow-ups and any substantive support reply, and the customer explicitly complains about the lack of updates.
evidence: Customer (2025-10-17T12:09:00+00:00): requests technical team to take a closer look; no support response until 2025-10-29.
Customer (2025-10-23T06:39:25+00:00): forwards config for review; no support response until 2025-10-29.
Customer (2025-10-27T13:00:03+00:00): "It has now been two weeks since our last communication, and unfortunately, we have not received any concrete feedback on the issue."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Support attempted to close the ticket as a duplicate while the customer was still awaiting help and later stated they could not access the referenced duplicate ticket, meaning closure would have cut off their support path.
evidence: Support (Zubair, 2025-10-29T08:41:15+00:00): "We will close this ticket... kindly reply on ticket# 60216786"
Customer (2025-10-29T13:46:26+00:00): "It looks like a reply was sent to the ticket I unfortunately don’t have access to... continue the communication using Ticket #60220499"

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: Although the customer later escalates and an internal note marks severity as core_functionality_defect, support does escalate to L2 and raises priority to High. The ticket is not clearly labeled P1/SEV1/Critical in the customer-visible flow, and escalation is visible once severity is raised.
evidence: Mike Kebede (2025-11-04T11:43:01+00:00): "We’ve escalated this case to the L2 team and raised the priority to High."
